title: Looking for light Clarendons
content:
If anyone knows of any light clarendons (or similar) other than [Clarendon Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024053454/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/clarendon/light/),  
I'd be grateful.  
Thanks in advance,  
T
author: T Bones

comments.content:
Hi T,

my typeface [Parry](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024053454/http:/www.ourtype.be/) offers an alternative to Clarendon. It comes with a matching grotesque.

Best,  
Artur

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*  
new release at [www.ourtype.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024053454/http:/www.ourtype.com/ "www.ourtype.com") : Parry and Parry Grotesque

I'm also very excited about Parry. Welcome to Typophile, Artur.

Storm's [Farao](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024053454/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/farao/?refby=typographica) is a wonderful exaggeration of egyptian forms.

OT/

Hi Artur,

Can I just say your (company's) website is truly amazing! I am not a big fan of Flash these days, but you can tell a lot of thought went into the process.

/OT

[Group94](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024053454/http:/www.group94.com/). They also did [mine](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024053454/http:/www.fontshop.be/). It has a killer Flash-based Content Management System. It rawks. :^)

Hey guys, like you, yes, I think Group 94 is great and we love working with them!  
But, besides the Flash-based Content Management these websites - OurType, and FontShop BNLx (yours, Yves ? :-)) - are the result of a collaboration between 2 teams: the clients and g94.  
In the case of both websites, there were clear demands and expectations regarding site's functions, and a starting point regarding the graphics (certainly in the case of OurType).

\> _FontShop BNLx (yours, Yves ? :-))_

Well, smartypants, Rudy had it specially designed and built for little ol' me, and I'm the only one writing for it, often slaving away till 2-3 am (I have to wake up at 7 am to bring my kids to school and go to work). So Corina, please forgive me if I take the liberty of calling it "mine", even though that obviously is poetic license. I really don't think anyone believes I own FontShop. :^P

OK T Bones, sorry for this little diversion. Here's some more suggestions:

[Dispatch](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024053454/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FB.106472.0.0) and [Freight Micro](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024053454/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=GF.118888.0.0) are very nice, somewhat more angular alternatives.

[Monotype Ionic](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024053454/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=M.230.0.0), when used big, has a similar appearance to Clarendon Light, but with slightly more stress (looks more handmade).

And I've always liked the generous width of [Volta](http://web.archive.org/web/20131024053454/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=UR.110085.0.0).
